= Indexes Sample Pseudocode 2 - Simple/Basic Index =

Following is a pseudocode example of a relatively simple, basic index.

{{{

<index>
   <index.head>
      <index.title>Index</index.title>

      <index.headnotes>
         <p>Locators in italics indicate a figure reference.  You can filter the index by the following categories: actors, politicians or sports figures.</p>
      </index.headnotes>

      <index.legend>
         <symbol>italics</symbol><definition>table</definition>
      </index.legend>

      <generic.list>
         <term idref="act">Actors</term>
         <term idref="pol">Politicians</term>
         <term idref="spo">Sports figures</term>
      </generic.list>

   </index.head>

   <index.body>

      <index.group id="gA">
         <group.title>A</group.title>
         <index.entry id="a001" level="1">
            <term id="a002" semantic.content.type="act">actors</term>
            <locator semantic.structure.type="tex">3-7</locator>
            <locator semantic.structure.type="tab">7</locator>
            <xref idref="act" xref.type="relatedgeneric">names of specific actors</xref>
         </index.entry>
         <index.entry id="a003" level="1">
            <term id="a004" semantic.content.type="act pol">Azmi, Shabana</term>
            <locator semantic.structure.type="fig">12-13</locator>
            <locator semantic.structure.type="tex">15</locator>
            <locator semantic.structure.type="tex">18-22</locator>
         </index.entry>
      </index.group>

      <index.group id="gC">
         <group.title>C</group.title>
         <index.entry id="c001" level="1">
            <term id="c002" semantic.content.type="">Cruise, Tom</term>
            <locator semantic.structure.type="fig">27</locator>
            <locator semantic.structure.type="tex">26-28</locator>
         </index.entry>
      </index.group>

      <index.group id="gD">
         <group.title>D</group.title>
         <index.entry id="d001" level="1">
            <term id="d002" semantic.content.type="act">De Niro, Robert</term>
            <locator semantic.structure.type="fig">35</locator>
            <locator semantic.structure.type="tex">36</locator>

            </index.entry>

      <index.group id="gM">

            <!-- see reference -->

         </index.entry>
      </index.group>

      <index.group id="gR">
         <group.title>R</group.title>
